faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about Code for Taiwan

questions.question: What is Code for Taiwan?
questions.answer: Code for Taiwan is a civic tech community dedicated to solving social problems through open-source technology, promoting government transparency and civic engagement. We bring together technologists, designers, and citizens who care about society to create meaningful digital solutions.

questions.question: Can I participate without a technical background?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We welcome participants from all backgrounds. Besides engineers and designers, we also need skills in coordination, content editing, community management, policy research, and more. Everyone can learn programming thinking to improve their work efficiency.

questions.question: How can I start learning programming thinking?
questions.answer: You can start by attending our workshops, joining our Discord discussion groups, or directly checking out our learning resources on GitHub. We regularly host beginner-friendly courses to help everyone develop programming thinking.

questions.question: Are all Code for Taiwan learning resources free?
questions.answer: Yes, all our learning resources are open source and freely available to the public. We believe knowledge dissemination is key to bridging the urban-rural gap, so our materials, tools, and resources are open to everyone.

questions.question: How can I contact the Code for Taiwan team?
questions.answer: You can reach us through our official website, social media platforms, or by directly attending our physical events. We also welcome you to join our online community to discuss and exchange ideas with other participants.

events.title: Explore Our Events
events.subtitle: Join our workshops, hackathons, and community meetups to create change through technology

section.title: Join Our Team
section.description: Whether you're a developer, designer, or a citizen concerned about social issues, we welcome your participation. Let's use technology to make Taiwan better together!
